name: Classic Pancakes
steps: In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, and baking powder.
Create a well in the center and pour in milk and eggs.
Whisk the mixture together until it forms a smooth batter.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease with butter.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface and the edges look set, about 2-3 minutes.
Flip the pancake and cook the other side until golden brown, about 1-2 minutes.
Serve warm with maple syrup, fresh fruit, or your favorite toppings.

name: Spinach and Feta Omelette
steps: In a small bowl, whisk eggs with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add a small amount of olive oil.
Add spinach to the skillet and sauté until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Pour the whisked eggs over the spinach, tilting the skillet to spread evenly.
Crumble feta cheese over one side of the omelette.
Cook until the eggs are mostly set, about 3-4 minutes.
Fold the omelette in half and cook for an additional minute.
Slide onto a plate and serve hot.

name: Banana Oatmeal Smoothie
steps: Peel the banana and add it to a blender.
Add oats, milk, honey, and vanilla extract to the blender.
Blend on high speed until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
Taste and adjust sweetness by adding more honey if needed.
Pour the smoothie into a glass and serve immediately.

name: Avocado Toast with Poached Egg
steps: Toast slices of bread in a toaster or under the broiler until golden brown.
Cut the avocado in half, remove the pit, and scoop the flesh into a bowl.
Mash the avocado with a fork until smooth, then season with salt and pepper.
Spread the mashed avocado evenly over the toasted bread.
Bring a pot of water to a gentle simmer and add a splash of vinegar.
Crack an egg into a small bowl and gently slide it into the simmering water.
Poach the egg for 3-4 minutes, until the whites are set but the yolk is still runny.
Remove the egg with a slotted spoon and place it on top of the avocado toast.
Sprinkle with additional salt and pepper, and serve immediately.

name: Blueberry Muffins
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C) and grease a muffin tin or line with paper liners.
In a mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and a pinch of salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, eggs, and melted butter.
Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined.
Gently fold in the blueberries, being careful not to overmix.
Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cup about 2/3 full.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow the muffins to cool in the tin for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Serve warm or store in an airtight container for up to 3 days.

name: French Toast with Maple Syrup
steps: In a shallow dish, whisk together eggs, milk, vanilla extract, and cinnamon.
Heat a skillet or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease with butter.
Dip each slice of bread into the egg mixture, coating both sides.
Place the soaked bread on the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown.
Serve hot with maple syrup, powdered sugar, or fresh fruit.

name: Greek Yogurt Parfait with Granola and Berries
steps: In a tall glass or bowl, layer Greek yogurt, granola, and berries.
Repeat the layers until the glass is full, finishing with a layer of berries on top.
Drizzle with honey and serve immediately.

name: Breakfast Burrito with Scrambled Eggs and Salsa
steps: Whisk eggs in a bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Heat a skillet over medium heat and lightly grease with butter or oil.
Scramble the eggs until cooked, about 3 minutes.
Warm the tortilla in the skillet for 1-2 minutes.
Fill the tortilla with scrambled eggs, cheese, salsa, and sautéed bell peppers.
Roll the tortilla tightly and serve warm.

name: Vegan Tofu Scramble
steps: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Crumble tofu into the skillet and sprinkle with turmeric.
Add diced bell peppers and onions, and sauté for 5 minutes.
Stir in spinach and cook until wilted.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve.

name: Sausage and Egg Breakfast Casserole
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C) and grease a baking dish.
Cook sausage in a skillet over medium heat until browned, then set aside.
In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.
Layer bread cubes in the greased baking dish, followed by cooked sausage and shredded cheese.
Pour the egg mixture over the layers, ensuring even coverage.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the top is golden and the casserole is set.
Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

name: Peanut Butter and Banana Toast
steps: Toast the bread slices in a toaster or under the broiler until golden brown.
Spread a generous layer of peanut butter on each slice of toast.
Slice the banana into thin rounds and place them evenly on top of the peanut butter.
Drizzle with honey for extra sweetness.
Serve immediately.

name: Scrambled Eggs with Smoked Salmon
steps: In a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.
Heat butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and cook, stirring gently, until soft curds form.
Remove the skillet from heat just before the eggs are fully cooked to avoid overcooking.
Gently fold in pieces of smoked salmon.
Garnish with chopped chives and serve immediately.

name: Sweet Potato Hash with Eggs
steps: Peel and dice the sweet potato into small cubes.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat and add the sweet potato.
Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sweet potato starts to soften.
Add diced onions and bell peppers to the skillet and cook for another 5 minutes.
Make small wells in the hash and crack an egg into each well.
Cover the skillet and cook until the eggs are set to your liking, about 5 minutes.
Serve hot.

name: Overnight Chia Pudding
steps: In a jar or bowl, combine chia seeds, milk, vanilla extract, and honey.
Stir well to ensure the chia seeds are evenly distributed.
Cover and refrigerate overnight or for at least 6 hours.
In the morning, stir the pudding and add more milk if needed for desired consistency.
Top with fresh berries and serve.

name: Apple Cinnamon Oatmeal
steps: In a saucepan, combine oats, milk, and a pinch of salt.
Bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
Grate or dice the apple and add it to the oatmeal, along with cinnamon and brown sugar.
Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until the oatmeal is thick and creamy.
Serve warm, topped with additional apple slices and a sprinkle of cinnamon if desired.
